hook.text: Two coffee shops sit across the street. One charges $2, the other $5. The $5 shop has a longer line. Why?

buildup.text: Competitive advantage is what makes customers choose you over rivals. It can be cost, quality, brand, or experience.

discovery.text: Porter says advantages come in two forms: cost leadership (cheapest) or differentiation (unique value worth paying for).

twist.text: Being 'stuck in the middle'â€”not cheapest, not differentiatedâ€”is the worst position. Pick a lane and commit to it.

climax.text: Sustainable advantage comes from things competitors can't easily copy: culture, network effects, or deep expertise.

punchline.text: If everyone can do what you do, you have no advantage.

quiz.question: What are Porter's two forms of competitive advantage?
